member.name: T:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Jpeg.JpegSegmentData
member.summary: Holds a collection of JPEG data segments.
member.remarks:
Holds a collection of JPEG data segments. This need not necessarily be all segments within the JPEG. For example, it may be convenient to store only the non-image segments when analysing metadata.
Segments are keyed via their . Where multiple segments use the same segment type, they will all be stored and available.
Each segment type may contain multiple entries. Conceptually the model is: Map<JpegSegmentType, Collection<byte[]>>. This class provides convenience methods around that structure.
member.author: Drew Noakes https://drewnoakes.com

member.remarks: Gets segment data for a specific occurrence and type. Use this method when more than one occurrence of segment data for a given type exists.
member.param: identifies the required segment
the zero-based index of the occurrence
member.returns: the segment data as a byte[], or null if no segment exists for the type & occurrence

member.name: T:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Jpeg.JpegSegmentReader
member.summary: Performs read functions of JPEG files, returning specific file segments.
member.remarks: JPEG files are composed of a sequence of consecutive JPEG 'segments'. Each is identified by one of a set of byte values, modelled in the enumeration. Use to read out the some or all segments into a object, from which the raw JPEG segment byte arrays may be accessed.
member.author: Drew Noakes https://drewnoakes.com

member.remarks: Will not return SOS (start of scan) or EOI (end of image) segments.
member.param: a file from which the JPEG data will be read.
the set of JPEG segments types that are to be returned. If this argument is null then all found segment types are returned.

the set of JPEG segments types that are to be returned. If this argument is null then all found segment types are returned.

member.summary: Provides human-readable string versions of the tags stored in an AdobeJpegDirectory.

member.name: T:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Adobe.AdobeJpegDirectory
member.summary: Contains image encoding information for DCT filters, as stored by Adobe.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Adobe.AdobeJpegDirectory.TagApp14Flags0
member.summary: The convention for TAG_APP14_FLAGS0 and TAG_APP14_FLAGS1 is that 0 bits are benign.
member.remarks:
The convention for TAG_APP14_FLAGS0 and TAG_APP14_FLAGS1 is that 0 bits are benign. 1 bits in TAG_APP14_FLAGS0 pass information that is possibly useful but not essential for decoding.
0x8000 bit: Encoder used Blend=1 downsampling

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Adobe.AdobeJpegDirectory.TagApp14Flags1
member.summary: The convention for TAG_APP14_FLAGS0 and TAG_APP14_FLAGS1 is that 0 bits are benign.
member.remarks: The convention for TAG_APP14_FLAGS0 and TAG_APP14_FLAGS1 is that 0 bits are benign. 1 bits in TAG_APP14_FLAGS1 pass information essential for decoding. DCTDecode could reject a compressed image, if there are 1 bits in TAG_APP14_FLAGS1 or color transform codes that it cannot interpret.

member.summary: Base class for several Exif format tag directories.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagNewSubfileType
member.summary: The new subfile type tag.
member.remarks: 0 = Full-resolution Image 1 = Reduced-resolution image 2 = Single page of multi-page image 3 = Single page of multi-page reduced-resolution image 4 = Transparency mask 5 = Transparency mask of reduced-resolution image 6 = Transparency mask of multi-page image 7 = Transparency mask of reduced-resolution multi-page image

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagSubfileType
member.summary: The old subfile type tag.
member.remarks: 1 = Full-resolution image (Main image) 2 = Reduced-resolution image (Thumbnail) 3 = Single page of multi-page image

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagBitsPerSample
member.summary: When image format is no compression, this value shows the number of bits per component for each pixel.
member.remarks: Usually this value is '8,8,8'.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagPhotometricInterpretation
member.summary: Shows the color space of the image data components.
member.remarks: 0 = WhiteIsZero 1 = BlackIsZero 2 = RGB 3 = RGB Palette 4 = Transparency Mask 5 = CMYK 6 = YCbCr 8 = CIELab 9 = ICCLab 10 = ITULab 32803 = Color Filter Array 32844 = Pixar LogL 32845 = Pixar LogLuv 34892 = Linear Raw

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagThresholding
member.summary: 1 = No dithering or halftoning 2 = Ordered dither or halftone 3 = Randomized dither

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagFillOrder
member.summary: 1 = Normal 2 = Reversed

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagStripOffsets
member.summary: The position in the file of raster data.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagSamplesPerPixel
member.summary: Each pixel is composed of this many samples.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagRowsPerStrip
member.summary: The raster is codified by a single block of data holding this many rows.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagStripByteCounts
member.summary: The size of the raster data in bytes.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagPlanarConfiguration
member.summary: When image format is no compression YCbCr, this value shows byte aligns of YCbCr data.
member.remarks: If value is '1', Y/Cb/Cr value is chunky format, contiguous for each subsampling pixel. If value is '2', Y/Cb/Cr value is separated and stored to Y plane/Cb plane/Cr plane format.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagCfaPattern2
member.summary: There are two definitions for CFA pattern, I don't know the difference...

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagExposureTime
member.summary: Exposure time (reciprocal of shutter speed).
member.remarks: Unit is second.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagFnumber
member.summary: The actual F-number(F-stop) of lens when the image was taken.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagExposureProgram
member.summary: Exposure program that the camera used when image was taken.
member.remarks: '1' means manual control, '2' program normal, '3' aperture priority, '4' shutter priority, '5' program creative (slow program), '6' program action (high-speed program), '7' portrait mode, '8' landscape mode.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagOptoElectricConversionFunction
member.summary: Indicates the Opto-Electric Conversion Function (OECF) specified in ISO 14524.
member.remarks:
OECF is the relationship between the camera optical input and the image values.
The values are:
Two shorts, indicating respectively number of columns, and number of rows.
For each column, the column name in a null-terminated ASCII string.
For each cell, an SRATIONAL value.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagSensitivityType
member.summary: Applies to ISO tag.
member.remarks: 0 = Unknown 1 = Standard Output Sensitivity 2 = Recommended Exposure Index 3 = ISO Speed 4 = Standard Output Sensitivity and Recommended Exposure Index 5 = Standard Output Sensitivity and ISO Speed 6 = Recommended Exposure Index and ISO Speed 7 = Standard Output Sensitivity, Recommended Exposure Index and ISO Speed

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagTimeZoneOffset
member.summary: Non-standard, but in use.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagCompressedAverageBitsPerPixel
member.summary: Average (rough estimate) compression level in JPEG bits per pixel.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagShutterSpeed
member.summary: Shutter speed by APEX value.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagAperture
member.summary: The actual aperture value of lens when the image was taken.
member.remarks: Unit is APEX. To convert this value to ordinary F-number (F-stop), calculate this value's power of root 2 (=1.4142). For example, if the ApertureValue is '5', F-number is 1.4142^5 = F5.6.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagMaxAperture
member.summary: Maximum aperture value of lens.
member.remarks: You can convert to F-number by calculating power of root 2 (same process of ApertureValue:0x9202). The actual aperture value of lens when the image was taken. To convert this value to ordinary f-number(f-stop), calculate the value's power of root 2 (=1.4142). For example, if the ApertureValue is '5', f-number is 1.41425^5 = F5.6.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagSubjectDistance
member.summary: Indicates the distance the autofocus camera is focused to.
member.remarks: Tends to be less accurate as distance increases.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagMeteringMode
member.summary: Exposure metering method.
member.remarks: '0' means unknown, '1' average, '2' center weighted average, '3' spot, '4' multi-spot, '5' multi-segment, '6' partial, '255' other.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagWhiteBalance
member.summary: White balance (aka light source).
member.remarks: '0' means unknown, '1' daylight, '2' fluorescent, '3' tungsten, '10' flash, '17' standard light A, '18' standard light B, '19' standard light C, '20' D55, '21' D65, '22' D75, '255' other.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagFlash
member.summary: 0x0 = 0000000 = No Flash 0x1 = 0000001 = Fired 0x5 = 0000101 = Fired, Return not detected 0x7 = 0000111 = Fired, Return detected 0x9 = 0001001 = On 0xd = 0001101 = On, Return not detected 0xf = 0001111 = On, Return detected 0x10 = 0010000 = Off 0x18 = 0011000 = Auto, Did not fire 0x19 = 0011001 = Auto, Fired 0x1d = 0011101 = Auto, Fired, Return not detected 0x1f = 0011111 = Auto, Fired, Return detected 0x20 = 0100000 = No flash function 0x41 = 1000001 = Fired, Red-eye reduction 0x45 = 1000101 = Fired, Red-eye reduction, Return not detected 0x47 = 1000111 = Fired, Red-eye reduction, Return detected 0x49 = 1001001 = On, Red-eye reduction 0x4d = 1001101 = On, Red-eye reduction, Return not detected 0x4f = 1001111 = On, Red-eye reduction, Return detected 0x59 = 1011001 = Auto, Fired, Red-eye reduction 0x5d = 1011101 = Auto, Fired, Red-eye reduction, Return not detected 0x5f = 1011111 = Auto, Fired, Red-eye reduction, Return detected 6543210 (positions) This is a bitmask. 0 = flash fired 1 = return detected 2 = return able to be detected 3 = unknown 4 = auto used 5 = unknown 6 = red eye reduction used

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagFocalLength
member.summary: Focal length of lens used to take image.
member.remarks: Unit is millimeter. Nice digital cameras actually save the focal length as a function of how far they are zoomed in.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagMakernote
member.summary: This tag holds the Exif Makernote.
member.remarks:
Makernotes are free to be in any format, though they are often IFDs. To determine the format, we consider the starting bytes of the makernote itself and sometimes the camera model and make.
The component count for this tag includes all of the bytes needed for the makernote.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagWinTitle
member.summary: The image title, as used by Windows XP.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagWinComment
member.summary: The image comment, as used by Windows XP.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagWinAuthor
member.summary: The image author, as used by Windows XP (called Artist in the Windows shell).

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagWinKeywords
member.summary: The image keywords, as used by Windows XP.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagWinSubject
member.summary: The image subject, as used by Windows XP.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagColorSpace
member.summary: Defines Color Space.
member.remarks: DCF image must use sRGB color space so value is always '1'. If the picture uses the other color space, value is '65535':Uncalibrated.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagFocalPlaneResolutionUnit
member.summary: Unit of FocalPlaneXResolution/FocalPlaneYResolution.
member.remarks: '1' means no-unit, '2' inch, '3' centimeter. Note: Some of Fujifilm's digicam(e.g.FX2700,FX2900,Finepix4700Z/40i etc) uses value '3' so it must be 'centimeter', but it seems that they use a '8.3mm?'(1/3in.?) to their ResolutionUnit. Fuji's BUG? Finepix4900Z has been changed to use value '2' but it doesn't match to actual value also.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagCustomRendered
member.summary: This tag indicates the use of special processing on image data, such as rendering geared to output.
member.remarks: When special processing is performed, the reader is expected to disable or minimize any further processing. Tag = 41985 (A401.H) Type = SHORT Count = 1 Default = 0 0 = Normal process 1 = Custom process Other = reserved

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagExposureMode
member.summary: This tag indicates the exposure mode set when the image was shot.
member.remarks: In auto-bracketing mode, the camera shoots a series of frames of the same scene at different exposure settings. Tag = 41986 (A402.H) Type = SHORT Count = 1 Default = none 0 = Auto exposure 1 = Manual exposure 2 = Auto bracket Other = reserved

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagWhiteBalanceMode
member.summary: This tag indicates the white balance mode set when the image was shot.
member.remarks: Tag = 41987 (A403.H) Type = SHORT Count = 1 Default = none 0 = Auto white balance 1 = Manual white balance Other = reserved

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagDigitalZoomRatio
member.summary: This tag indicates the digital zoom ratio when the image was shot.
member.remarks: If the numerator of the recorded value is 0, this indicates that digital zoom was not used. Tag = 41988 (A404.H) Type = RATIONAL Count = 1 Default = none

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.Tag35MMFilmEquivFocalLength
member.summary: This tag indicates the equivalent focal length assuming a 35mm film camera, in mm.
member.remarks: A value of 0 means the focal length is unknown. Note that this tag differs from the FocalLength tag. Tag = 41989 (A405.H) Type = SHORT Count = 1 Default = none

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagSceneCaptureType
member.summary: This tag indicates the type of scene that was shot.
member.remarks: It can also be used to record the mode in which the image was shot. Note that this differs from the scene type (SceneType) tag. Tag = 41990 (A406.H) Type = SHORT Count = 1 Default = 0 0 = Standard 1 = Landscape 2 = Portrait 3 = Night scene Other = reserved

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagGainControl
member.summary: This tag indicates the degree of overall image gain adjustment.
member.remarks: Tag = 41991 (A407.H) Type = SHORT Count = 1 Default = none 0 = None 1 = Low gain up 2 = High gain up 3 = Low gain down 4 = High gain down Other = reserved

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagContrast
member.summary: This tag indicates the direction of contrast processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.
member.remarks: Tag = 41992 (A408.H) Type = SHORT Count = 1 Default = 0 0 = Normal 1 = Soft 2 = Hard Other = reserved

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagSaturation
member.summary: This tag indicates the direction of saturation processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.
member.remarks: Tag = 41993 (A409.H) Type = SHORT Count = 1 Default = 0 0 = Normal 1 = Low saturation 2 = High saturation Other = reserved

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagSharpness
member.summary: This tag indicates the direction of sharpness processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.
member.remarks: Tag = 41994 (A40A.H) Type = SHORT Count = 1 Default = 0 0 = Normal 1 = Soft 2 = Hard Other = reserved

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagDeviceSettingDescription
member.summary: This tag indicates information on the picture-taking conditions of a particular camera model.
member.remarks: The tag is used only to indicate the picture-taking conditions in the reader. Tag = 41995 (A40B.H) Type = UNDEFINED Count = Any Default = none The information is recorded in the format shown below. The data is recorded in Unicode using SHORT type for the number of display rows and columns and UNDEFINED type for the camera settings. The Unicode (UCS-2) string including Signature is NULL terminated. The specifics of the Unicode string are as given in ISO/IEC 10464-1. Length Type Meaning ------+-----------+------------------ 2 SHORT Display columns 2 SHORT Display rows Any UNDEFINED Camera setting-1 Any UNDEFINED Camera setting-2 : : : Any UNDEFINED Camera setting-n

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagSubjectDistanceRange
member.summary: This tag indicates the distance to the subject.
member.remarks: Tag = 41996 (A40C.H) Type = SHORT Count = 1 Default = none 0 = unknown 1 = Macro 2 = Close view 3 = Distant view Other = reserved

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.ExifDirectoryBase.TagImageUniqueId
member.summary: This tag indicates an identifier assigned uniquely to each image.
member.remarks: It is recorded as an ASCII string equivalent to hexadecimal notation and 128-bit fixed length. Tag = 42016 (A420.H) Type = ASCII Count = 33 Default = none

member.name: T:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.Makernotes.FujifilmMakernoteDescriptor
member.summary: Provides human-readable string representations of tag values stored in a .

Fujifilm added their Makernote tag from the Year 2000's models (e.g.Finepix1400, Finepix4700). It uses IFD format and start from ASCII character 'FUJIFILM', and next 4 bytes (value 0x000c) points the offset to first IFD entry.
:0000: 46 55 4A 49 46 49 4C 4D-0C 00 00 00 0F 00 00 00 :0000: FUJIFILM........ :0010: 07 00 04 00 00 00 30 31-33 30 00 10 02 00 08 00 :0010: ......0130......
There are two big differences to the other manufacturers.
Fujifilm's Exif data uses Motorola align, but Makernote ignores it and uses Intel align.
The other manufacturer's Makernote counts the "offset to data" from the first byte of TIFF header (same as the other IFD), but Fujifilm counts it from the first byte of Makernote itself.
member.author: Drew Noakes https://drewnoakes.com

member.name: T:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.Makernotes.NikonType1MakernoteDescriptor
member.summary: Provides human-readable string representations of tag values stored in a .
member.remarks:
Type-1 is for E-Series cameras prior to (not including) E990. For example: E700, E800, E900, E900S, E910, E950.
Makernote starts from ASCII string "Nikon". Data format is the same as IFD, but it starts from offset 0x08. This is the same as Olympus except start string. Example of actual data structure is shown below.
:0000: 4E 69 6B 6F 6E 00 01 00-05 00 02 00 02 00 06 00 Nikon........... :0010: 00 00 EC 02 00 00 03 00-03 00 01 00 00 00 06 00 ................
member.author: Drew Noakes https://drewnoakes.com

member.name: T:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.Makernotes.NikonType1MakernoteDirectory
member.summary: Describes tags specific to Nikon (type 1) cameras.
member.remarks:
Describes tags specific to Nikon (type 1) cameras. Type-1 is for E-Series cameras prior to (not including) E990. There are 3 formats of Nikon's Makernote. Makernote of E700/E800/E900/E900S/E910/E950 starts from ASCII string "Nikon". Data format is the same as IFD, but it starts from offset 0x08. This is the same as Olympus except start string. Example of actual data structure is shown below.
:0000: 4E 69 6B 6F 6E 00 01 00-05 00 02 00 02 00 06 00 Nikon........... :0010: 00 00 EC 02 00 00 03 00-03 00 01 00 00 00 06 00 ................
member.author: Drew Noakes https://drewnoakes.com

member.name: T:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.Makernotes.NikonType2MakernoteDescriptor
member.summary: Provides human-readable string representations of tag values stored in a . Type-2 applies to the E990 and D-series cameras such as the D1, D70 and D100.
member.author: Drew Noakes https://drewnoakes.com

member.name: T:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.Makernotes.NikonType2MakernoteDirectory
member.summary: Describes tags specific to Nikon (type 2) cameras.
member.remarks:
Type-2 applies to the E990 and D-series cameras such as the E990, D1, D70 and D100.
Thanks to Fabrizio Giudici for publishing his reverse-engineering of the D100 makernote data. http://www.timelesswanderings.net/equipment/D100/NEF.html
Note that the camera implements image protection (locking images) via the file's 'readonly' attribute. Similarly image hiding uses the 'hidden' attribute (observed on the D70). Consequently, these values are not available here.
Additional sample images have been observed, and their tag values recorded in API documentation for each tag's field. New tags have subsequently been added since Fabrizio's observations.
In earlier models (such as the E990 and D1), this directory begins at the first byte of the makernote IFD. In later models, the IFD was given the standard prefix to indicate the camera models (most other manufacturers also provide this prefix to aid in software decoding).
member.author: Drew Noakes https://drewnoakes.com

Values observed - 180.0,180.0,2.8,2.8 (D100) - 240/10 850/10 35/10 45/10 - 18-70mm f/3.5-4.5 (D70) - 17-35mm f/2.8-2.8 (D1X) - 70-200mm f/2.8-2.8 (D70) Nikon Browser identifies the lens as "18-70mm F/3.5-4.5 G" which is identical to metadata extractor, except for the "G". This must be coming from another tag...

member.summary: Added during merge of Type2 & Type3.
member.remarks: Added during merge of Type2 & Type3. May apply to earlier models, such as E990 and D1.

member.summary: The amount of digital zoom used.

Whether the flash was used in this image.

1 Manual Flash

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.Makernotes.NikonType2MakernoteDirectory.TagShootingMode
member.summary: The camera's shooting mode.
member.remarks:
The camera's shooting mode.
A bit-array with:
0 Single Frame
1 Continuous
2 Delay
8 PC Control
16 Exposure Bracketing
32 Auto ISO
64 White-Balance Bracketing
128 IR Control

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.Makernotes.NikonType2MakernoteDirectory.TagLensStops
member.summary: Lens stops, as an array of four integers.
member.remarks:
Lens stops, as an array of four integers. The value, in EV, is calculated as a*b/c.
64,1,12,0 = 5.33 EV
72,1,12,0 = 6 EV

The color space as set in the camera, as a string.
MODE1 = Mode 1 (sRGB)
MODE1a = Mode 1 (sRGB)
MODE2 = Mode 2 (Adobe RGB)
MODE3 = Mode 2 (sRGB): Higher Saturation
MODE3a = Mode 2 (sRGB): Higher Saturation
B & W = B & W

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.Makernotes.PanasonicMakernoteDirectory.TagFaceDetectionInfo
member.summary:
Integer (16Bit) Indexes: 0 Number Face Positions (maybe less than Faces Detected) 1-4 Face Position 1 5-8 Face Position 2 and so on
The four Integers are interpreted as follows: (XYWH) X,Y Center of Face, (W,H) Width and Height All values are in respect to double the size of the thumbnail image

member.summary: 0 = Off 1 = Low 2 = Standard 3 = High

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.Makernotes.PanasonicMakernoteDirectory.TagPrintImageMatchingInfo

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Exif.Makernotes.PanasonicMakernoteDirectory.TagFaceRecognitionInfo
member.summary:
Byte Indexes: 0 Int (2 Byte) Number of Recognized Faces 4 String(20 Byte) Recognized Face 1 Name 24 4 Int (8 Byte) Recognized Face 1 Position (Same Format as Face Detection) 32 String(20 Byte) Recognized Face 1 Age 52 String(20 Byte) Recognized Face 2 Name 72 4 Int (8 Byte) Recognized Face 2 Position (Same Format as Face Detection) 80 String(20 Byte) Recognized Face 2 Age
And so on
The four Integers are interpreted as follows: (XYWH) X,Y Center of Face, (W,H) Width and Height All values are in respect to double the size of the thumbnail image

member.summary: Attempts to convert the given ISO2022 escape sequence to an encoding name.

member.name: M:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Iptc.Iso2022Converter.GuessEncoding(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Attempts to guess the encoding of a string provided as a byte array.
member.remarks:
Encodings trialled are, in order:
UTF-8
ISO-8859-1
ASCII
Its only purpose is to guess the encoding if and only if iptc tag coded character set is not set. If the encoding is not UTF-8, the tag should be set. Otherwise it is bad practice. This method tries to workaround this issue since some metadata manipulating tools do not prevent such bad practice.
About the reliability of this method: The check if some bytes are UTF-8 or not has a very high reliability. The two other checks are less reliable.
member.param: some text as bytes
member.returns: the name of the encoding or null if none could be guessed

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.IHDR
member.summary: Denotes a critical that contains basic information about the PNG image.
member.remarks:
This must be the first chunk in the data sequence, and may only occur once.
The format is:
pixel width 4 bytes, unsigned and greater than zero
pixel height 4 bytes, unsigned and greater than zero
bit depth 1 byte, number of bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel)
color type 1 byte, maps to enum
compression method 1 byte, currently only a value of zero (deflate/inflate) is in the standard
filter method 1 byte, currently only a value of zero (adaptive filtering with five basic filter types) is in the standard
interlace method 1 byte, indicates the transmission order of image data, currently only 0 (no interlace) and 1 (Adam7 interlace) are in the standard

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.PLTE
member.summary: Denotes a critical that contains palette entries.
member.remarks:
This chunk should only appear for a of , and may only occur once in the PNG data sequence.
The chunk contains between one and 256 entries, each of three bytes:
red 1 byte
green 1 byte
blue 1 byte
The number of entries is determined by the chunk length. A chunk length indivisible by three is an error.

member.name: F:MetadataExtractor.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.tEXt
member.summary: Denotes an ancillary that contains textual data, having first a keyword and then a value.
member.remarks:
If multiple text data keywords are needed, then multiple chunks are included in the PNG data stream.
The format is:
keyword 1-79 bytes
null separator 1 byte (\0)
text string 0 or more bytes
Text is interpreted according to the Latin-1 character set [ISO-8859-1]. Newlines should be represented by a single linefeed character (0x9).

the set of visited IFD offsets, to avoid revisiting the same IFD in an endless loop

member.name: T:MetadataExtractor.ImageMetadataReader
member.summary: Reads metadata from any supported file format.
member.remarks:
This class a lightweight wrapper around other, specific metadata processors. During extraction, the file type is determined from the first few bytes of the file. Parsing is then delegated to one of:
for JPEG files
for TIFF and (most) RAW files
for Photoshop files
for PNG files
for BMP files
for GIF files
for ICO files
for PCX files
for WebP files
for RAF files
If you know the file type you're working with, you may use one of the above processors directly. For most scenarios it is simpler, more convenient and more robust to use this class.
is used to determine the provided image's file type, and therefore the appropriate metadata reader to use.
member.author: Drew Noakes https://drewnoakes.com

member.name: M:MetadataExtractor.Rational.GetSimplifiedInstance
member.summary: Simplifies the number.
member.remarks:
Prime number series: 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, 13, 17
To reduce a rational, need to see if both numerator and denominator are divisible by a common factor. Using the prime number series in ascending order guarantees the minimum number of checks required.
However, generating the prime number series seems to be a hefty task. Perhaps it's simpler to check if both d & n are divisible by all numbers from 2 -> (Math.min(denominator, numerator) / 2). In doing this, one can check for 2 and 5 once, then ignore all even numbers, and all numbers ending in 0 or 5. This leaves four numbers from every ten to check.
Therefore, the max number of pairs of modulus divisions required will be:
4 Math.min(denominator, numerator) - 1 -- * ------------------------------------ + 2 10 2 Math.min(denominator, numerator) - 1 = ------------------------------------ + 2 5
member.returns: A simplified instance, or if the Rational could not be simplified, returns itself unchanged.

member.name: T:MetadataExtractor.Face
member.summary: Models information about a face in an image.
member.remarks:
When a face is detected, the camera believes that a face is present at a given location in the image, but is not sure whose face it is. When a face is recognised, then the face is both detected and identified as belonging to a known person.
Currently this is only used by .
member.author: Philipp Sandhaus, Drew Noakes
